item.title: Programmatically Creating Kubernetes Manifests
item.description: A while ago I came across a utility named jk, which purported to be able to create structured text files—in JSON, YAML, or HCL—using JavaScript (or TypeScript that has been transpiled into JavaScript). One of the use cases was creating Kubernetes manifests. The GitHub repository for jk describes it as “a data templating tool”, and that’s accurate for simple use cases. In more complex use cases, the use of a general-purpose programming language like JavaScript in jk reveals that the tool has the potential to be much more than just a data templating tool—if you have the JavaScript expertise to unlock that potential.
